intro: Anemopaegma alatum, commonly known as the winged anemone, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often colorful flowers. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive wing-like appearance, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shady environments and has a short growing season. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, hairy fruits that disperse its seeds by wind.
